content:
The test cases are not sufficient here. I got 100% on tests in a Shortest mode clash just now and then only 80% on validators.

The problem is the '-' symbol in Validator 3 causes issues for the 'tr' function in Ruby and other languages. Please add another test case that has '-' as a symbol, so that people can debug this problem in the clash, rather than finding out after they submit.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice Clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is nice for a shortest-code.
There is a syntax error in the default code for C, C#, C++, Closure (I stopped after this), all wrong variable name for c_2. Otherwise I like the task.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle.

I like this one, here are a few things I noticed:
- No default write/output at the stub
- I think you should state that INPUT only consists of the 2 given letters
- Default variable names are too long and confusing for a Clash game (having _input as a variable in Python was a little bit weird for me)

Again, this is only my personal first impression after playing the puzzle, so no need to take them if you feel like they are wrong.

Anyways, I really like the puzzle, so I will give an approve tomorrow, you will probably read this by then. :)

Thanks for the fun contribution!

If you want to have this as a "fastest" clash i'd rather you just instruct the player to swap the requested characters. I don't think the language you used is familiar to everyone either. If you described the characters as having bit values 0 and 1 and asked for the ! of the value that would make more sense maybe. I like it as a reverse puzzle though. I do worry that this is too similar to a ATCG puzzle that asks for A's / T's and C's / G's to be flipped to complementary values. (Its DNA themed)

Hi everyone,

I actually wanted to set a case where the intput/output would be empty and another one where output would be a whitespace only ... but can't manage to do it ... got an error while submitting the clash (Field is empty ...)

So if anyone can help me with this i can update the clash or leave it as is if no feedback.

This is my 1st contribution so be kind and do not hesitate to give me advices ;)

Have fun

Hi,
Thx for taking time.

I didn't meant to do a "Fastest" clash but a "Shortest code" one cause as you said there are a lot of clash in the "DNA" theme with fastest mode.

For the language, i wanted to make it a bit more 'elaborate' to intend  people more focused, i believe saying "Hey just replace char with the reverse one" would be like.... too easy or boring ...

Let me know your thoughs about this considering this answer ;)

regards

Thx for your time ;)

I updated the challenge, let me know if it fits more your expectations ;)

Oh what a strange behaviour ! I'll need to dig to fix that.
Thx
I renamed the vars, it seems to have fixed the issues :)

Its great! Thanks for listening to my feedback!
I'm late though, other people already approved it :D
Can't wait to see this (and the solutions of others) in clash!

yes but NOR isn't exactly common nomenclature. I wouldn't be happy about losing a clash because someone knows the term "NOR" and I didn't. Maybe I'm too much of an outsider. Consider adding examples of NOR in the statement in addition to what is in the test cases.

no need to show exemple for "nor"
the real problem is that it is not a "nor" ... it is a "not"

Well i rename the challenge and updated the Goal.

Let me know if everythings OK now :)
